title: Want soloq? stop bitching start acting, this is how you get it back.
body:
So Riot thought lets make a dynamic queue more premades less toxicity more accesible to casuals and will probably increase our income/playerbase

Most likely, they never planned on re-releasing soloQ yes they promised etc etc but,
they are just stalling waiting for the fallout to blow over and continue as if nothing happened.

Just think about it for a second they put in money and effort to make dynamicQ a thing to increase their revenue and they want a return on investment. Enabling soloQ will take solo players out of dynamicQ vastly increasing queue times which will make it fail.

You really want soloQ that bad?
The only solution is to stop playing ranked solo and not spending money!

The queue time will increase and increase and their revenue will dwindle and it will force them to enable soloQagain again to stop it

As players we do have a say in what Riot does, just not by spamming the boards with please bring back soloque and other kinds of whimpy bitching but rather by hitting them where it hurts untill they give us soloQ

If people continue to play ranked and spend money anyways then Riot really wont have any incentive to change things.
After all Riot is a bussiness they make money and therefore will act accordingly to whatever makes them the most.

Let me share my story on why I am quitting ranked.

* Your MMR and rank are most likely not in conjunction with your skills. You were probably lucky enough to have been teamed with a booster.
* Almost every single game, there is a duo queue. Your team, enemy team, it doesn't matter. And they either dominate or they feed, together. It got so repetitive that ranked solo queue is no longer fun.
* Majority of these duo queue act as one. If one trolls or AFK's, the other will too. If one sucks, the other will too.
* Duo queue ruins the game especially when one of them is 1 tier higher than the other. It could benefit you if that 1 tier higher player is on your team, but then, did you really earned the win?

I wanna compete based on my skills and with people that are in the same skill range as me. I'm sick and tired of queuing for ranked and pray that I get carried by duo queue. Or get dominated by an enemy who is being boosted.

First and foremost, stop paying Riot anymore money. Stop supporting them until they give you what you want.
Secondly, stop playing ranked solo queue as per OP said. Draft pick is just as fun, you can play any champ in any role.
Lastly, stop whining and start acting.

The pros are unhappy with the current situation (look at players like Hai, Bjergsen, Froggen, and many others), many players are unhappy with being matched with premades, others want a queue that reflects individual skill better. There are so many good reasons for soloQ, but Riot won't even talk to the community honestly about it. You see, there is a point where I disagree with you. You say "Riot is a business, therefore, they will always prioritize what makes more money (or, in this case, prioritize what loses them the least amount of money in the long run)." Just because there's a business doesn't mean that Riot as an entity is a hive mind of corporate robots. There are some people that genuinely want this game to be great.

If they only cared about money, why would they give you the chance to earn free shit with hextech crafting? Why would they bother to reduce the prices of champions every once in a while?

Anyway, that's a bit beside the point, but I'm tired of people saying that Riot is this big, reptilian entity that only cares about money.

Onward, then...

What Riot wanted to do with dynamic queue is essentially create a team builder that people would actually use. In a perfect world, the community would play both a solo and dynamic queue out of preference in pretty substantial numbers. However, this is not a perfect world and there are many outside factors that contributed to the failure of team builder in the first place. People say team builder doesn't matter, not enough people played it so the queue times were abysmal, thus circularly killing off any audience it had in the first place. More people quit because of the terrible queue times, and thus the queue times get worse.

A lot of people feel like dynamic queue and solo queue can exist at the same time, but I highly doubt that that is the case. Solo queue is highly competitive, and may draw more of the hard core players that don't like to support, alleviating the queue times in dynamic queue, but realistically you know this community will shame anyone who wants to play dynamic queue, because it's "not a true ranked ladder experience" or it's "for people to get boosted by their friends."

The social pull of the community is not to be underestimated. Solo queue will probably just overtake this mode if it's released again. Is that a bad thing? Not necessarily, but I for one like this type of mode and would hate to see it go... that is, if it had it's issues straightened out. Sure I have some issues with it, but they're pretty minor and can probably be sorted out. I'll complain a lot about it, but really I'm just complaining about people who abuse the system and ruin my games because of it, not so much dynamic queue itself.

> If they only cared about money, why would they give you the chance to earn free shit with hextech crafting? Why would they bother to reduce the prices of champions every once in a while?

these are actually really common business practices.  box stores do this all the time.  my local grocery has both sales and the monopoly prize game, and its all to increase profits.  i dont know exactly how it works, but something to do with increasing interest in the store (more visits) increases money spent long-term.  Riot wants us to play more, and invite more friends, which will theoretically increase sales in the long term.

people saying Riot is "evil" are just exaggerating cause theyre upset.  but dont think for a minute that income isnt a huge priority for them.  League is now a huge game with a MASSIVe amount of subscribers (which were gained extremely quickly), and since theres no subscription fees... they need to make waaaay more mulah now just in order to maintain their upgraded infrastructure.  i feel a bit bad for them.  but only a bit.  they couldve only sold like..... half their souls to satan at least....

And, yeah, it does increase interest a little.

However, I feel like hextech crafting was meant for the players, and Riot wanted to reward the die-hard players out there. That's just my interpretation.

I was just pointing out that Riot can do a lot more slimy things than they actually end up doing. Electronic Arts and Ubisoft get away with shit like microtransactions to help you win in the middle of a game (purchasing ammo with cash) or they could just keep all champions at 6300 ip, so it takes fucking forever to get any champion at all without grinding the equivalent of a human lung's black market value, or just shelling out to actually get something useful. They also could keep making champions that are strictly better than previous ones on purpose so you'd have to buy it, but they don't.

Either way, my point about the queues still stands.
